intro: Orthanthera stricta, commonly known as the slender beardtongue, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and tubular flowers. The plant typically features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Orthanthera stricta thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats. It is valued in native plant gardens for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
